Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; whitish slip; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat running to right (only one foreleg remaining); dot rosette as filling ornament; below, band of short vertical strokes between pairs of lines; below, part of band of crescents.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Cook places the sherd within the coarser and later style of the Lion Group. The vases in this group are clumsier than the earlier vases.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 41, no. 149 pl. 35, no. 149)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 244, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.029)
